Stereonet (poles)

Source: R/stereo_pole.R
stereo_pole.Rd

Draws the poles to planes (great circles) on an equal area stereonet.

stereo_pole(dir, dip, points.col = "blue", points.shape = 3, add = FALSE)

Arguments

dir

A vector of dip directions in degrees
dip

A vector of dip angles in degrees
points.col

Color for the poles
points.shape

Shape value (pch) for the poles
add

A logical indicating to add or not the poles to an existing plot

Value

A stereonet plot

Details

This can be added to a stereonet from stereo_plane()

Examples

dip.dir <- runif(min = 120, max = 170, n = 20)
dip <- runif(min = 10, max = 60, n = 20)
stereo_pole(dip.dir, dip)

#> $x
#>  [1] -0.26625257 -0.10295111 -0.28932942 -0.23018702 -0.07772999 -0.04308744
#>  [7] -0.15299482 -0.35943596 -0.15918209 -0.48551328 -0.16114046 -0.17786993
#> [13] -0.06748998 -0.05902373 -0.19050435 -0.24358120 -0.35933455 -0.42927491
#> [19] -0.22392486 -0.13172188
#> 
#> $y
#>  [1] 0.3238909 0.3043326 0.3325374 0.3961455 0.3147355 0.2428903 0.2097568
#>  [8] 0.5754808 0.3421636 0.3654102 0.1842941 0.5181177 0.2243330 0.1184067
#> [15] 0.3423092 0.3912741 0.5872107 0.5159161 0.5817264 0.4979647
#> 
stereo_plane(dip.dir, dip, dir = "dip")

stereo_pole(dip.dir, dip, add = TRUE)

#> $x
#>  [1] -0.26625257 -0.10295111 -0.28932942 -0.23018702 -0.07772999 -0.04308744

#> [19] -0.22392486 -0.13172188
